title: Calls To Extend Paid Parental Leave As Cost Of Living Pushes Mums Back To Work | 10 News+
description: The government is being urged to extend paid parental leave to 52 weeks, as the rising cost of living is forcing more Australian mothers to head back into the office before they’re ready. 10 News+ reporter Claudia Vrdoljak spoke to working mums, and a parent leadership coach, about the crisis. title: Andrew Stripped Of Prince Title, Possible New Dinosaur Species, Sydney's Halloween Street | 10 News+
description: Prince Andrew's fall from grace is now complete. He has been stripped of his royal titles and will be evicted from his home. The move by his brother King Charles comes after mounting pressure from parliamentarians and the public to take action against the Royal pariah, over allegations he sexually assaulted the late Jeffrey Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre.  Researchers believe they may have discovered a new dinosaur species called Nanotyrannus in 67 million-year-old fossils found in Montana in 2006. One of the skeletons was initially thought to be a young Tyrannosaurus rex, but a new research paper suggests otherwise.   Australians are developing quite a love for Halloween, with a whopping $2.3 billion set to be spent this spooky season. Renwick Street, Drummoyne, in Sydney's Inner West, has become an officially sponsored street for trick-or-treating, with free lollies provided to decorated houses to hand out. title: Anthony Albanese Meets Xi Jinping & South Korea’s President Lee At APEC | 10 News+
description: Anthony Albanese met briefly with China’s Xi Jinping on Day 1 of the APEC Summit in South Korea. He denies the timing of his Asia trip is linked to an Australian navy frigate patrolling the South China Sea this week. He also sat down for formal talks with the host president, South Korea’s Lee Jae Myung, who was given the green light from the United States to build nuclear-powered submarines. title: Australia’s Tornado Watch, Prine Andrew Demoted, Kim Kardashian’s Moon Conspiracies | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – parts of Australia are being hit by severe storms, with hail delaying sports fixtures in NSW, while Queensland braces severe storms and possible tornados. title: Researchers Discover Potential New Dinosaur Species In 67 Million-Year-Old Fossils | 10 News+
description: Researchers believe they may have discovered a new dinosaur species called Nanotyrannus in 67 million-year-old fossils found in Montana in 2006. One of the skeletons was initially thought to be a young Tyrannosaurus rex, but a new research paper suggests otherwise. 10 News+ speaks to UNSW Paleontologist Michael Archer about this scientific development. title: Sudan Horror, Witnesses Report Mass Executions After Al-Fashir Falls | 10 News
description: Hundreds of unarmed men have reportedly been executed near Sudan’s city of al-Fashir after Rapid Support Forces (RSF) seized the last army stronghold in Darfur following an 18-month siege.  Survivors who escaped to Tawila say fighters rounded up civilians, separated men from women and shot detainees after hurling racial slurs, with satellite analysis suggesting systematic ethnic-based killings.  Reuters and UN-verified videos show RSF fighters shooting captives and bodies scattered across streets, despite RSF denials and claims of “media exaggeration”.  Yale’s Humanitarian Research Lab says violence mirrors early stages of the Rwandan genocide, describing “door-to-door clearance operations” targeting non-Arab communities.  International concern is growing amid accusations the UAE armed RSF forces, allegations it denies, as aid agencies warn tens of thousands remain trapped and unaccounted for. title: Train Smashes Truck Trapped At Crossing | 10 News
description: Security camera vision has captured the moment a passenger train slammed into a truck at a level crossing in the Dutch town of Meteren, disrupting rail services between Utrecht and Den Bosch.  The truck appeared to stop and reverse before becoming trapped as the boom gates came down.  Seconds later, the train ploughed into the vehicle, sending debris flying across the tracks.  Five people suffered minor injuries, local media reported. title: Police Hunt Partner After Mother-Of-Three Killed In Suspected Domestic Violence Attack | 10 News
description: We begin with the manhunt for a suspect wanted in connection to the domestic violence murder of a woman, north of Sydney.  The 39-year-old mother of three was killed in her home, the screams of a child who may've witnessed her death alerted neighbours.  Her partner is on the run, potentially armed with a gun. title: Dozens Killed And Power Lines Down As Jamaica Begins Recovery From Hurricane Melissa | 10 News
description: The death toll from Hurricane Melissa has soared with almost 50 people killed in the deadliest storm to ever hit Jamaica.  The focus is now shifting to recovery, with aid, food and water desperately needed, as hundreds of thousands struggle without power.
